name: df-rprm
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5
body: |- wceq(crpm, cmpt(s0, universe, csb(s1, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), crab(s2, cdif(cv(s1), cun(cfv(cui, cv(s0)), csn(cfv(c0g, cv(s0))))), wral(s3, cv(s1), wral(s4, cv(s1), wsbc(s5, cfv(cdsr, cv(s0)), wi(wbr(cv(s2), cv(s5), co(cv(s3), cfv(cmulr, cv(s0)), cv(s4))), wo(wbr(cv(s2), cv(s5), cv(s3)), wbr(cv(s2), cv(s5), cv(s4)))))))))))
comment: Define the function associating with a ring its set of prime elements. A prime element is a nonzero non-unit that satisfies an equivalent of Euclid's lemma ~ euclemma . Prime elements are closely related to irreducible elements (see ~ df-irred ). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-Feb-2015.)
